intro: Kailarsenia jardinei, commonly known as the Jardine's kailar, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature and turn red upon ripening. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing near the forest floor. Due to habitat loss, Kailarsenia jardinei is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
